name: Osun-Osogbo Sacred Grove
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the Osun-Osogbo Sacred Grove is a dense forest along the banks of the Osun River, filled with sanctuaries, shrines, sculptures, and art dedicated to Osun, the goddess of fertility.

name: Ataoja's Palace
description: The royal palace of the Ataoja, the traditional ruler of Osogbo, showcasing historic Yoruba architecture and cultural heritage.

name: Erin Ijesha Waterfall
address: Erin Ijesha, Oriade LGA, Osun State
description: Also known as Olumirin Waterfalls, this beautiful seven-step waterfall is a popular tourist attraction and sacred site.

name: Obafemi Awolowo University
description: One of Nigeria's leading universities, known for its modernist architecture and contributions to Nigerian education and politics.

name: Ifa Temple
description: A sacred site for the practice of the Ifa divination system, central to Yoruba spirituality and religion.

name: Moremi Statue
description: The tallest statue in Nigeria, celebrating Queen Moremi Ajasoroâ€™s legendary sacrifice for the Yoruba people.

name: Ooni of Ife's Palace
description: The ancient palace of the Ooni, the paramount ruler of Ile-Ife, believed to be the cradle of Yoruba civilization.

name: Oshogbo City Stadium
description: A multi-purpose stadium used for sporting events and cultural festivals, including Osun-Osogbo.

name: National Museum, Ile-Ife
description: Features artifacts from ancient Ife civilization, including terracotta and bronze artworks.

name: OAU Zoological Garden
description: A recreational and educational zoo with a variety of animal species, used for tourism and research.
